utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know why I avoided the Harry Potter books for so long. These are great. I just started number six.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a good one. Dumbledore dies in that one. Yeah, I know, I didn’t see it coming, either.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You brought up the subject. I contributed an interesting fact on that subject. It’s called the art of conversation. Okay, your turn.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was a huge spoiler.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is wrong with you? If I did that, you’d bitch about it for weeks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, really, Leonard? Are you going to have another one of your hissy fits?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hissy fits? I have hissy fits?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and I have a theory why. Because of your lactose intolerance, you switched over to soy milk. Soy contains estrogen-mimicking compounds. I think your morning Cocoa Puffs are turning you into a hysterical woman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You are unbelievable. I don’t know why I put up with you. You’re controlling, you’re irritating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There you go again, nag, nag, nag. You’re only proving my point, little lady.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? Screw you, Sheldon. You are the most annoying person I have ever met.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? I’m annoying? You criticize my behaviour all the time. Sheldon, don’t talk about your bowel movements over breakfast. Sheldon, when the president of the university is giving a eulogy at a funeral, don’t yawn and point at your watch. Sheldon, don’t throw away my shirts ’cause you think they’re ugly. You’re impossible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s it. I don’t, I don’t have to put up with this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I have your signature on a roommate agreement that says you do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw. Here’s what I think of your roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You pick that up right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Roommate agreement, section 27, paragraph 5, the roommate agreement, like the American flag, cannot touch the ground.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t care. I don’t have to do anything you say because I don’t think I want to live here anymore.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To live with Penny and not you, you crazy bastard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Crazy bastard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, wait.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dobby the elf dies in book seven.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What, you don’t say thank you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s my suitcase. I lent it to you two years ago.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, then, I should tell you I broke the wheel and the handle. So, is everyone from Bernadette’s company going to Vegas?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, just me, her and a couple of the big wigs. It’s part of a bonus she got.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Cool. Did she discover a cure for something?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not exactly. They spent a ton of money developing this dandruff medication that had the side effect of horrible anal leakage.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is there a good anal leakage?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyway, it was Bernie’s idea to rebrand the stuff as a cure for constipation.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Way to make lemonade. You know, from around the corner where fudge is made.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I got a favour to ask.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My mom’s been kind of an emotional wreck since that dentist she was dating dumped her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dumped her? What, did he use a forklift? Sorry. There’s nothing funny about morbid obesity.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s huge. It was funny. Anyway, I was just hoping that maybe you could check in on her tomorrow night and make sure she’s doing okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, I’m a single man. Saturday night is my party night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? What do you got going on?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe drive down to Hollywood, hit a few hot spots, see if I can get lucky.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, tell me if this sounds familiar. You pay fifteen dollars to park, you stand on the pavement for an hour until you break down and give the bouncer twenty bucks to let you in. You push your way to the bar, where you drink an eighteen dollar cosmopolitan, then you stare at a pretty girl and imagine your perfect life together. Your children, grandchildren. Meanwhile, she leaves with a guy who claims he wrote Beverly Hills Chihuahua. Then you give up on anyone ever loving you, go to Marie Callender’s, buy a pie and eat it in your car in the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told her around seven.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I swear, that man is the most egotistical, insufferable human being I have ever met.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but you two make such a cute couple. Like Burt and Ernie. You guys even teach me stuff about words and numbers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I’ve had it. I am done. I can’t, I can’t live with him for one more minute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. Where are you going to go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was thinking here with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That a problem?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, not at all. No, it’s, it’s great. It’s terrific. I, you know, I just can’t help feel bad about Sheldon. I mean, how’s he going to get by without you? Ernie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s got Amy now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, he does, but it’s not the same.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, well, um, all right. You, you know how in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, Ron didn’t abandon Harry just because Harry started dating Ron’s sister?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Harry and Ginny get together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry. Spoiler alert. My point is, as much as I want to live with you, I can’t do it knowing how much Sheldon needs you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please, the only thing he needs me for is to be his whipping boy, his, his stooge, his doormat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you know what they say, if it ain’t broke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow. It sounds to me like you don’t want us to live together.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No, no, I do. I do. It’s just, I mean, it’s a really big step.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is it? We’re together all the time. Financially, it makes great sense. Can you think of one reason why we shouldn’t do this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, um, I’m just a little thirsty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. I’ll go get my stuff.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay, all right, don’t freak out. You can make this work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, could you clear off a shelf for me in the bathroom? I take a lot of medicine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, please let some of it be Xanax.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Are you ready for dessert?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, thank you, Mrs. Wolowitz. As it is, I’m going to have to carry my stomach out of here like I’m a fireman rescuing an infant.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Oh, please. You’re a tall glass of brown water. Have dessert.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I, I really couldn’t. But, uh, I’ve had a lovely time eating your brisket and hearing about the things you’ve had removed from your body over the years. Didn’t know you could have a cyst inside another cyst.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: The doctor said they were like Russian nesting dolls. Well, if you have to go, how about I put a little doggie bag together for you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That would be lovely. Thank you. Mrs. Wolowitz, uh, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Don’t mind me. I just cry when I’m lonely and have nothing to live for.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I, uh, I suppose I could stay for some dessert.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Great. You like chocolate chip cheesecake?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I’ll make one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One vintage Mr. Mxyzptlk action figure. That’s Leonard’s.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Children’s toy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One Star Trek: The Next Generation phaser. That’s Leonard’s.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Children’s toy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One Game of Thrones collector’s edition Longclaw sword. Oh, Leonard and I bought that together. That’s a bit of an ethical conundrum. Eh, I’ll keep it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, uh, what’s your plan moving forward?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, suppose I’ll have to find and cultivate a new roommate. What a task that will be. Do you know how uncivilized Leonard was when I took him in?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it took me forever to get him on a bathroom schedule. He would just go whenever the mood struck him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Like a dog-boy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What if you could find a roommate who was a scientist and already familiar and comfortable with your ways?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That would be ideal. If a person like that existed, I would sign on, no further questions asked.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great. Here I am!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Here who is where?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me. Aren’t I your perfect roommate?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Think about it, Sheldon. I’m not a stranger, we’re intellectually compatible, I’m willing to chauffeur you around town, and your personality quirks, which others find abhorrent or rage-inducing, I find cute as a button. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Tell me one reason why this isn’t a fantastic idea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: See? You can’t. I’m gonna go see if Leonard’s room is big enough for my water bed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good buddy Leonard. Good buddy Leonard. Good buddy Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, good buddy. So, uh, I was just talking to Amy, and she made me realize that this little dust-up between you and me is much ado about nothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. All is forgiven, so come back home. I’ll make you some soy hot chocolate, and then I’ll you tell you about our exciting new devil-may-care bathroom policy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Amy’s decided she wants to move in with me, so I need you to come back home, you lovable scamp. That’s a lot of product.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, get this, suddenly, Sheldon wants me back because Amy wants to move in with him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, too late, pal. I’m not going anywhere. Penny and I are very happy living together. Isn’t that right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s like the happiness won’t ever leave the apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, please. You know Amy moving in marks a level of intimacy our relationship isn’t ready for.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. That is a real thing. And it doesn’t mean you don’t care about each other, it just means things are moving at a pace you’re not comfortable with, and that’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, if he doesn’t want to live with her, then he should tell her how he feels.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, maybe he doesn’t know how to say it without hurting her feelings.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Feelings? What am I, a hippie at a love-in? No. The problem is, she laid out a series of logical arguments that I couldn’t refute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is the worst, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Sheldon. I can’t help you. Oh, spoiler alert, this door’s about to slam in your face.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, there you are. When do I get a key to our apartment?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey. How’d it go last night with my mom?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What time did you leave?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I’m still here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? You spent the night?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, after dinner, we watched a rerun of Rockford Files, and then she opened a bottle of, uh, cream sherry, and the next thing I know, she was tucking me into your bed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You wore my pyjamas?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. How do you sleep in these things? Silk pajamas on satin sheets? I slid out of the bed, like, three times.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Rajesh! You up? You ready for breakfast?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, boy. Breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, Raj, listen to me. You need to get out of there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I have a cream sherry hangover and I smell blintzes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you don’t leave now, she’ll use food and guilt to keep you there for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, Howard, stop.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Trust me, you’re not Jewish. That’s how they get you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re being silly. I can leave whenever I want.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, really? Where are your clothes and your shoes?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They’re on the chair, right over… Oy vey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, home wrecker.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You gave Leonard somewhere to go. Thanks to you, Amy’s out buying his and hers bath towels. Like I’d ever dry myself with something that has a possessive pronoun on it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Listen, the truth is I don’t want him living with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. Kick him out. Break his heart. Everybody wins.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I don’t want to break his heart. I love him. This is just happening too fast.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think this is fast? It’s just a matter of time before I see Amy’s leg stubble in my shower.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, and I’ve seen those legs. You might want to get some Drano.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on. If you don’t want to live with Leonard, why don’t you just tell him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you know how he is. He’s sensitive and emotional.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s because he drinks too much soy milk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know what else we can do but tell them the truth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose there’s no choice but to face the crying, angry accusations and the high-pitched wails of despair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. And who knows how Amy will react.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here’s some more ice.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What were we thinking? We should have just done it the regular way.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Those Chinese acrobats in Cirque du Soleil made it look so easy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Honestly, if I could bend that far, what would I need with you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you could bend that far, you’d be doing us both a favour.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Raj. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You were right. I can’t get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re still at my mother’s?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m trapped. My clothes have been in the laundry all day, and she hid my keys. I think they might be in her bra, because she jingles when she walks. What do I do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, you wanted a woman in your life. Now you got one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, Howard, help me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Rajesh, tatellah, I ran you a bath.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God. She’s not gonna bathe me, is she?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gee, I wish I could tell you no. All right, well, thanks again for helping me out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But, Howard…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Should we go back and rescue him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s too late. We’ll see him at his Bar Mitzvah.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Here you go. I picked up the Chinese food just the way Leonard used to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it kung pao chicken?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brown rice, not white rice?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Spicy mustard from the Korean deli?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes. I did good, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Amy, are you worried that us living together will take the mystery out of our relationship?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, why would you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, and, uh, check this out. I took the liberty of scripting a new outgoing voice mail message for both of us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. This is Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And this is Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re not home right now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: ‘Cause we out dropping science, son.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Leave a message.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Beep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t live here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What? Why? Is it the message? I only used urban slang to sound tough so people wouldn’t break in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. It’s not the message.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, what is it, then? I did everything just the way you like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You did.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Then what the hell, Sheldon? We have been going out for over two years, and I have been nothing but patient with you. I watch your dopey space movies. I signed your ridiculous contract. I even stopped wearing lip gloss ’cause you said it made my mouth look too slippery. I am the best girlfriend you’re ever gonna have. You give me one good reason why I can’t live here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s Penny’s fault.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She doesn’t want to live with Leonard, so he has to come live here again. She’s the snake in our garden. She’s the reason we can’t be happy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Ames.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, Ames, nothing. I was all set to move in with Sheldon, and now I hear I can’t ’cause you don’t want to live with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what did you say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said the truth. You don’t want to live with Leonard, and you know it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Since when don’t you want to live with me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, don’t get all huffy. You’re the one who decided to move in without even asking me if I was ready.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I think we should talk about that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And since you love the truth so much, why don’t you tell Amy you don’t want to live with her instead of blaming it on me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought we were talking about the other thing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re a coward.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, the evidence does support that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, Amy, let’s go drink wine and talk about what jerks our boyfriends are.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know what would show them? I should move in here with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you want to catch up on some Walking Dead?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: ‘Kay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you seen the one where Lori dies?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or maybe she doesn’t. Let’s find out.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: Raj (screams)
utterance.content: No!
